shapes-java example

1) Description

Shapes-java is an example of Gateway usage with Java DSL.

It requires the ishapes graphical demo which is bundled with Gateway.

The Shapes-java example demonstrates how to build Camel routes using Java DSL. The file GatewayRoutesDefinition.java has different examples of DDS routes definition. Un-comment the one you want to test.

The Shapes-java example also shows some Spring-defined Camel route in its src/main/resources/META-INF/spring/camel-context.xml file.

2) Scenario

Use an instance of ishapes demo to publish some shapes (Circle or Square). Use another instance of ishape demo to subscribe to shapes topics (Square and Triangles).

The Shapes-java examples defines a route from a DDS topic (e.g. Circle) to another DDS topic (e.g. Square), possibly performing some transformation on the route (e.g. modifying (x,y) coordinates, throttling the samples ...).

3) Building/Running

Environment Setup

  • Make sure to have Maven executable (mvn) and Java executable in PATH.
  • Make sure to have Vortex OpenSplice environment set (on Linux sourcing Vortex OpenSplice's release.com file).

Building the example:

  • Change directory to examples/shapes-java and execute:
    • mvn package

Running the Java example:

  • Open a command prompt and change directory to examples/shapes-java.
  • Start the Vortex OpenSplice service:
    • ospl start
  • Start a first ishapes demo with following command:
    • on Linux/Unix: ./run-ishapes.sh
    • in Windows: run-ishapes.bat
  • Click on "publish" button to start publication of a moving blue shape in "circle" topic.
  • Start a second iShapes demo with same command:
    • on Linux/Unix: ./run-ishapes.sh
    • in Windows: run-ishapes.bat
  • In "Subscriber" part, change the Shape to "square" and click on "subscribe" button to subscribe to "square" topic.
    Nothing appear since nothing is published in "square" topic.
  • Start this Gateway example with following command:
    • mvn exec:java
  • Now you should see a moving blue square in second iShapes demo.
    Gateway routes all data from "circle" topic to "square" topic.

You can edit the shapes-java/src/main/java/com.prismtech.gateway/examples/shapes/GatewayRoutesDefinition.java file to un-comment other examples of routes, and test them with the iShapes demo.

Running the Spring example:

  • Open a command prompt and change directory to examples/shapes-java.
  • Start the Vortex OpenSplice service:
    • ospl start
  • Start a first ishapes demo with following command:
    • on Linux/Unix: ./run-ishapes.sh
    • in Windows: run-ishapes.bat
  • Click on "publish" button to start publication of a moving blue shape in "circle" topic.
  • Start a second iShapes demo with same command:
    • on Linux/Unix: ./run-ishapes.sh
    • in Windows: run-ishapes.bat
  • In "Subscriber" part, change the Shape to "square" and click on "subscribe" button to subscribe to "square" topic. Subscribe to the "triangle" topic in the same way.
    Nothing appear since nothing is published in "square" nor "triangle" topics.
  • Start this Gateway Spring example with following command:
    • mvn camel:run
  • Now you should see moving blue square and triangle in second iShapes demo.
    Gateway routes all data from "circle" topic to "square" topic, and all data from "square" topic to "triangle" topic, but changing size and position on-the-fly.

Running the Graphical REST Client example

This example demonstrates a graphical Web page polling DDS shapes data via REST requests. Note that the source code of this demo is in following files:

  • src/main/java/.../ShapesToRest.java : for the REST Camel routes
  • src/main/resources/html/index.html : for the client HTML/JavaScript page

To run this example:

  • Open a command prompt and change directory to examples/shapes-java.
  • Start the Vortex OpenSplice service:
    • ospl start
  • Start as many ishapes demo you want (some publishing shapes, some subscribing shapes) with following command:
    • on Linux/Unix: ./run-ishapes.sh
    • in Windows: run-ishapes.bat
  • Start this Gateway example with following command:
    • mvn -PShapesToRest exec:java
  • In a Web browser, go to following URL:
    • http://localhost:4444/index.html
    • Click on "Refresh" button to poll a snapshot of iShapes demo via REST requests.
